page.title: 13Hathersham Farm
page.content: {Hathersham Farm}covers{447 acres,}rent Â£42 per acre.200 ft above sea level, rainfall 28/ 30 ins.-drains into Burstow stream, then River Mole. All grassland-{52 fields,}for a herd of {300 Friesian milking cows.}There are 4 bulls, 2 Herefords and 2 Angus for {meat}production.For milk production cows are artificially inseminated with Friesian semen. Today 162 cows are in milk,the others in calf.4 regular staff,2 men milk cows twice daily in Herringbone Parlour,where 32 cows stand, 16 milked at a time.Milk is refrigerated in bulk tanks and collected daily by{Milk {Marketing Board}bulk carrier.Each cow produces{5300 litres per year,current price 13.5 per litre.Cows valued at up to{Â£500}each.Five months summer grazing,in winter cows housed in cubiciles,fed on silage.
